ProposalInformation.Title: NIRISS Non-Redundant Mask (NRM) Performance
ProposalInformation.Abstract: The performance of the NIRISS non-redundant mask (NRM) will be characterized in its three crossed medium-band filters (F380M, F430M, and F480M) with bright stellar sources. The F277W broad-band filter is of lower priority and is not formally included to minimize the total duration of this activity. The positions of the sub-apertures of the NRM, projected on the primary mirror, shall be measured to an accuracy of 0.1%. A binary point source with known position angle, contrast and separation will be observed along with two calibrator stars.
ProposalInformation.ObservingDescription:
The observing sequence with either a science target or a calibrator star would be the following.
The observations will use the AMI-specific SUB80 80x80 subarray with the NISRAPID readout patterns. The target will be observed at primary and sub-pixel dither positions as specified. We will also observe the target and one calibrator with CLEARP+F480M. For these images we will offset the telescope pointing to pixel corner using Offset Special Requirement in APT. This is to minimize the number of saturated pixels in the core of the PSF. NIRISS pixel scale is ~65.39 mas in X and ~65.87 mas in Y. Therefore we will use Offset X = 0.0327" and Offset Y = 0.0329" to shift the pointing to pixel corner. All the observations are linked using GROUP NON-INIT Timing Special Requirement.
Details of observations: Number of groups for TargAcq = 9 (not good; see below).
Observation 1: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 6 Observation 2: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 7 Observation 3: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 8 Observation 4: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 9 Observation 5: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 10
Observation 6: SI Rehearsal #1: Two primary dithers, no subpixel dithers. Three filters F480M, F430M, F380M. This is a target (AMI nomenclature, not APT nomenclature) observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 7: SI Rehearsal #1: One primary dither, five subpixel dithers. F480M. This is a target (AMI nomenclature, not APT nomenclature) observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 8: SI Rehearsal #1: Two primary dithers, no subpixel dithers. Three filters F480M, F430M, F380M. This is a PSF reference observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 9: SI Rehearsal #1: Direct Image with NIRISS External Calibration template with offset. F480M Observation 10: SI Rehearsal #1: One primary dither, 25 subpixel dithers. F480M. This is a PSF reference observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode.
The number of NISRAPID groups in the TargAcqs of Observations 1 - 10 is wrong. The permitted number is 5, 11, and 19 (9 and 13 groups are for the SOSS TargAcq only). Hence, the above observations, some of which (6 - 10) were scheduled in Dry Run #2, are not valid and so we repeat them but with 19 groups for the TargAcq.
Observation 11: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 16 Observation 12: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 17 Observation 13: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 18 Observation 14: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 19 Observation 15: Dry Run #2: Duplicate of Observation 20
Observation 16: SI Rehearsal #1: Two primary dithers, no subpixel dithers. Three filters F480M, F430M, F380M. This is a target (AMI nomenclature, not APT nomenclature) observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 17: SI Rehearsal #1: One primary dither, five subpixel dithers. F480M. This is a target (AMI nomenclature, not APT nomenclature) observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 18: SI Rehearsal #1: Two primary dithers, no subpixel dithers. Three filters F480M, F430M, F380M. This is a PSF reference observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode. Observation 19: SI Rehearsal #1: Direct Image with NIRISS External Calibration template with offset. F480M Observation 20: SI Rehearsal #1: One primary dither, 25 subpixel dithers. F480M. This is a PSF reference observation. Target Acquision with AMIBRIGHT mode.

ObservationGroup.Label: Dry Run #2 (Oct 2018)
ObservationGroup.Comments: ETC workbook 22157 was used to calculate the exposure parameters for NRM+Filter observations. In the APT file we added an extra ~10 sec worth of NINTS at the beginning of each exposure in each filter to mitigate for persistence. Therefore the Integrations/Exposure are different in the APT file as compared to the ETC file.
